page.title: 01Introduction
page.content: Our area was mentioned in the first Domesday Book as a place of some importance, having a large manor and one of ten places in Cleveland with a church. We don't know where this church was situated.There are various theories, one is a wooden building where the Post Office is today.The church used today was built in 14 century. The Methodist church was visited a dozen times by John Wesley from 1759 onwards,he actually drew crowds to the Green. The two other major things we feel should be mentioned are the closing of the Mill opposite to the church in approx. 1908. The mill was demolished in 1937 to make way for widening the road to accommodate the ever increasing traffic. The bridge was widened to two lanes in April 1973, a footpath laid up Rudby Bank to the Bay Horse Pub.
